org.pure4j.annotations.immutable

Annotation Type IgnoreImmutableTypeCheck


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value={FIELD,METHOD})
public @interface IgnoreImmutableTypeCheck
    Overrides the field & method return-type checks on an @ImmutableValue class to ignore the checking of the field/method type. Since this is disabling some purity testing, it should be avoided if possible.

    1. Within @ImmutableValue classes

    This can be used to indicate that a field within the class is managed by the class, and won't be shared/exposed. For example, having an array field within an immutable value is not allowed, as the array is mutable. Preferentially, use a PersistentVector or similar to contain the array in an immutable structure.

    2. Return types for methods in @MutableState classes.

    Sometimes you cannot narrow the return type for a mutable state object far enough, perhaps because the return type is generic. You can use this annotation on the method to skip the checking of the return type.

    Author:
    robmoffat
